New Records: Daryl Mitchell scored 35 runs off 25 balls for New Zealand in the match.
India won the match by 168 runs, their highest margin in a T20I match in Ahmedabad since 2022.
Key Match Events: Mitchell Santner's leadership and strategic decisions were pivotal for New Zealand.
Hardik Pandya's captaincy and performance were crucial for India's win.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand aimed to make history by winning a bilateral series in India.
India's strong home record was a key factor in their favor.
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell Santner emphasized the importance of the victory for New Zealand's confidence.
Hardik Pandya praised the team's resilience and unity after the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the last of the series, with the outcome determining the winner.
The Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad was a high-scoring venue, supporting both teams' performances.
Others: The match was live-streamed in the UK on ESPN Player and in the USA on ESPN+.
